bibl.title: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, February 9, 1908

div1.p: The Kissingers inform Kelly of their poor financial situation and John Kissinger's failing health.

div1.head: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, February 9, 1908
div1.p:
its been
quite a while since we heard from
you Mr Kissinger and I often speak
about you and your kindness and
say we would have certainly suffered
this winter if it had not been for
your goodness.

Mr Kissinger keeps just about
the same no inprovement as
we can see he seems to grow
Thiner and whiter and weaker
iin his back he could not wash any
more I have been going out caring
for confinement cases by the day of
course most always want some one to
stay but that I cant do but go
Every day care for mother and babe an
now for a few days' having Lagrip
you know what that is without explination
have suffered considerable with it
we are having a sunny winter both are
glad its so near over we have no way
of getting out I have taken Mr Kissinger
several times this winter on a hard sled
to church about 4 blocks thats about
all we get out

as yet Mr Kissinger has not heard any
thing more about his pension there is
several working on it.

Kindest regards to you Secretary from
myself and Mr Kissinger

When convenient for you we would
like to hear from you

from Mrs John R Kissinger
best regards from Mr Kissinger
606 E Keaney St
South Bend
Ind.
